stitches on the first needle k2tog k1 with the second needle k1 ssk knit to the last 3 stitches on the needle k2tog k1 round 2 k all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until there are 16 20 24 28 32 36 40 stitches total then repeat round 1 every round until there are 8 12 12 16 16 16 20 stitches total graft the toe closed using the kitchener stitch http //knitty com/issuesummer04/ feattheresasum04 html for personal use only �4 picnic socks afterthought heel start before we begin the heel you can check out this wonderful afterthought heel tutorial by knitting up a storm at http //knitting-up-a-storm blogspot com/2009/04/afterthought-heel-pt1 html the tutorial uses double pointed needles but the idea remains the same pick up the live stitches held by the scrap yarn place the stitches closest to the sole on one needle and the stitches closest to the leg on another rejoin your mini skein yarn and knit the stitches on the first needle pick up and knit 2 stitches between the 2 needles making sure the split between the needles happens between the 2 picked up stitches knit the stitches on the next needle then pick and knit 2 stitches between the 2 needles making sure the split between the 2 needles happens between the 2 picked up stitches you should have 4 more stitches than you started with with your stitches split in half over the 2 needles and with the split happening between the 2 picked up stitches on each side afterthought heel finish round 1 with the first needle k1 ssk k to the last 3 stitches on the first needle k2tog k1 with the second needle k1 ssk knit to the last 3 stitches on the needle k2tog k1 round 2 k all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 12 16 20 24 28 32 total stitches remain you may adjust this stitch
